newsitem.title: FRANCE: French pilots strike disrupts short-haul flights.
newsitem.headline: French pilots strike disrupts short-haul flights.

text.p: Pilots at national airline Air France and Air France Europe, its short-haul division, began a four-day strike Tuesday, causing widespread disruption of European and domestic flights.
An airline spokeswoman said short-haul flights to Europe and the rest of France were cut by 60 percent at Charles de Gaulle Airport and by 66 percent at Orly Airport, which both serve Paris.
She said long-haul international flights were unaffected.

The strike was called to protest planned wage cuts for new pilots and changes in working conditions under a merger between the two airlines, which are combining to become more competitive as European airlines are opened up to cross-border competition.
